New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers set a new record by becoming the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each game.
The Cavaliers are the first team to start 10-0 since the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors.
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead, tying the eighth largest in the NBA's shot clock era.
Darius Garland scored 27 points and Evan Mobley had 23 as the Cavaliers routed the Golden State Warriors 136-117.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland's high-powered offense leads the league in points per game at 124.5 and with a.527 field goal percentage.
Coach Kenny Atkinson's up-tempo style quickly won over the team, including All-Star Donovan Mitchell.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson expressed pride in the team's effort and hunger, calling 10-0 a'magic number'.
Players noted they still haven't reached their potential and are committed to improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers outshot their opponent in each game but have won the rebounding battle only four times.
The team's depth and fast-paced style have paid dividends during their best start in franchise history.
Others: The article mentions the Associated Press contributed to the report and includes sponsored content sections.
